001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.activations.ActivationFunction;
005
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.List;
008
009/**
010 * Represents a single artificial neuron in a neural network.
011 * <p>
012 * A {@code Neuron} receives inputs from other neurons, combines them
013 * using a weighted sum plus a bias, and passes the result (the "logit")
014 * through an {@link ActivationFunction} to produce its output.
015 * </p>
016 *
017 * <h2>Computation</h2>
018 * For a neuron with inputs {@code x₁ … xₙ}, weights {@code w₁ … wₙ},
019 * and bias {@code b}, the forward activation is:
020 * <pre>
021 *   logit = b + Σ (wᵢ * xᵢ)
022 *   output = activationFunction.activate(logit)
023 * </pre>
024 *
025 * <h2>Lifecycle</h2>
026 * <ul>
027 *   <li>Before activation, the neuron has no valid {@code logit} or {@code output}.</li>
028 *   <li>{@link #activate()} computes the neuron’s output, caching
029 *       the logit and activation result and marking it as "activated".</li>
030 *   <li>{@link #deactivate()} resets the activation flag, allowing the neuron
031 *       to be re-evaluated (e.g., for another forward pass).</li>
032 *   <li>{@link #getLogit()} and {@link #getOutput()} may only be called
033 *       after activation.</li>
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * <h2>Thread safety</h2>
037 * <ul>
038 *   <li>Activation and deactivation are synchronized to prevent race conditions
039 *       in concurrent evaluation.</li>
040 *   <li>Weight and bias setters are not synchronized; concurrent modification
041 *       must be managed externally if required.</li>
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h2>Typical usage:</h2>
045 * <pre>{@code
046 * Neuron n1 = new Neuron("input1", List.of(), new Identity());
047 * Neuron n2 = new Neuron("input2", List.of(), new Identity());
048 * Neuron hidden = new Neuron("hidden", List.of(n1, n2), new Sigmoid());
049 *
050 * // set inputs manually
051 * n1.setBias(1.0f); n1.activate(); // identity, so output = bias
052 * n2.setBias(2.0f); n2.activate();
053 *
054 * hidden.setWeights(new float[]{0.5f, -0.3f});
055 * hidden.setBias(0.1f);
056 * hidden.activate();
057 *
058 * System.out.println(hidden.getOutput());
059 * }</pre>
060 */
061@DomainObject
062public class Neuron {
063
064    private final String name;
065    private final List<? extends Neuron> inputs;
066    private float[] weights;
067    private float bias;
068    /**
069     * Linear combination of inputs before activation.
070     */
071    protected float logit;
072    private final ActivationFunction activationFunction;
073    /**
074     * Cached output after applying the activation function.
075     */
076    protected float output;
077    /**
078     * Flag indicating whether {@link #activate()} has been called.
079     */
080    protected boolean activated;
081
082    /**
083     * Constructs a new neuron with the given name, inputs, and activation function.
084     *
085     * @param name               human-readable identifier
086     * @param inputs             input neurons (empty if none)
087     * @param activationFunction function to apply to the weighted sum
088     */
089    public Neuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputs, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
090        this.name = name;
091        this.inputs = inputs == null ? List.of() : inputs;
092        this.weights = new float[this.inputs.size()];
093        this.activationFunction = activationFunction;
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * @return the human-readable identifier of this neuron
098     */
099    public String getName() {
100        return name;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * @return the input neurons feeding into this neuron
105     */
106    public List<? extends Neuron> getInputs() {
107        return inputs;
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * @return the activation function applied to the weighted sum
112     */
113    public ActivationFunction getActivationFunction() {
114        return activationFunction;
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Computes the logit and output of this neuron by aggregating inputs,
119     * applying weights and bias, and passing the result through the
120     * activation function. Subsequent calls are ignored until
121     * {@link #deactivate()} is invoked.
122     */
123    public synchronized void activate() {
124        if (isActivated()) {
125            return;
126        }
127        logit = bias;
128        for (int i = 0; i < inputs.size(); i++) {
129            float input = inputs.get(i).getOutput();
130            logit += input * weights[i];
131        }
132        output = activationFunction.activate(logit);
133        activated = true;
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * @return whether this neuron has been activated
138     */
139    public boolean isActivated() {
140        return activated;
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Resets the activated flag so the neuron can be re-evaluated.
145     */
146    public synchronized void deactivate() {
147        activated = false;
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * @return the trainable weights of this neuron
152     */
153    public float[] getWeights() {
154        return weights;
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Sets the trainable weights of this neuron.
159     */
160    public void setWeights(float[] weights) {
161        this.weights = weights;
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * @return the trainable bias of this neuron
166     */
167    public float getBias() {
168        return bias;
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Sets the trainable bias of this neuron.
173     */
174    public void setBias(float bias) {
175        this.bias = bias;
176    }
177
178    /**
179     * Returns the pre-activation weighted sum of inputs.
180     *
181     * @return the computed logit
182     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
183     */
184    public float getLogit() {
185        if (!isActivated()) {
186            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
187        }
188        return logit;
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Returns the post-activation output of this neuron.
193     *
194     * @return the activated output value
195     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
196     */
197    public float getOutput() {
198        if (!isActivated()) {
199            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
200        }
201        return output;
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Finds the weight associated with a given source neuron.
206     *
207     * @param source the input neuron
208     * @return the corresponding weight, or {@code null} if not found
209     */
210    public Float findWeight(Neuron source) {
211        for (int i = 0; i < inputs.size(); i++) {
212            if (inputs.get(i) == source) {
213                return weights[i];
214            }
215        }
216        return null;
217    }
218
219    /**
220     * @return string representation including name, activation state, logit, output, weights, and bias
221     */
222    @Override
223    public String toString() {
224        return name + "{" + activated + ", " + logit + ", " + output + "}" + Arrays.toString(weights) + (bias >= 0.0 ? "+" : "") + bias;
225    }
226
227}
